Daily Home Screening for Students
Parents: Please complete this short check each morning we recommend that you keep your child home if they are not feeling well and report any yes answers to the below questions to your child's school nurse.

SECTION 1: Symptoms
Daily Home Screenings for Students:

If your child has any of the following symptoms, that indicates a possible illness that may decrease the student's ability to learn and also put them at risk for spreading illness to others. Please check your child for these symptoms:
Temperature 100.0 degrees Fahrenheit or higher
Sore throat
New uncontrolled cough that causes difficulty breathing (for students with chronic allergic/asthmatic cough, a change in their cough from baseline)
Diarrhea, vomiting, or abdominal pain
New onset of severe headache, especially with a fever
SECTION 2: Close Contact/Potential Exposure
Had close contact (within 6 feet of an infected person for at least 15 minutes) with a person with confirmed COVID-19
Traveled outside of Western New York in the past 14 days

A message from the Superintendent

Dear Citizens of the City of Niagara Falls,

Last night (February 25, 2020), the Niagara Falls City School District maintenance barn behind the High School was destroyed by fire. All of its contents are a total loss. As sad as this event is for our District, we are grateful that no one was injured in the fire. The Niagara Falls Police and Fire Departments were amazing. The City is lucky to have such brave men and women. Initial damages are in the $5 million range.

Trucks and equipment can be replaced. No one was hurt, making this a very somber event, but one we will soon recover from - we are Niagara Falls City School District strong. Thank you for your support.

Sincerely,
Mark Laurrie
Superintendent of Schools
Niagara Falls City School District
